info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:23PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN SWAIN AND NORTHWESTERN HAYWOOD COUNTIES UNTIL 300 PM EDT... At 223 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with torrential rainfall 11 miles northwest of Waynesville, or near Smoky Mountains-Balsam Mountain. This storm was nearly stationary. Locations to be impacted include... Smoky Mountains-Cataloochee, Smoky Mountains-Balsam Mountain, Maggie Valley, Smoky Mountains-Big Creek, Cherokee, Cove Creek and Fines Creek. Very heavy rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
